Calculate PRS evaluation metrics

prsRegressionMetrics.Rd

This function fits a regression model given a number of SNPs from which a PRS is calculated, in an iterative manner. Then, several metrics for goodness of fit are calculated and returned.

Usage

prsRegressionMetrics(snpSelection, gwe, response, 
        covariates = NULL, pcs = FALSE, step = 10, family = NULL,
        rc = NULL, ...)

Arguments

snpSelection

A data frame with candidate SNPs, the output, or part of the output of aggregatePrsMarkers, or one of the list members of the output of selectPrs.

gwe

A GWASExperiment object (same as the one used to generate prismaOut).

response

The trait for which a PRS is sought to be extracted. It should be a character of length 1 and exist in the phenotypes of gwe.

covariates

The covariates to include in regression models. It should be a character vector of traits all existing in the phenotypes of gwe.

pcs

Include PCs from gwe in the regression models? Defaults to FALSE.

step

Increment step for the number of SNPs from snpSelection to include in iterative evaluation. Defaults to 10.

family

Regression family of functions, e.g. "gaussian" for classical linear regression or "binomial" for logistic regression. See also gwa. Defaults to NULL for trying to set automatically.

rc

The fraction of available cores to use for parallel calculations. Default is NULL for no parallelization.

...

Further arguments passed to glm regression functions.

Value

A data frame with regression fit metrics, containing the following columns:

  • n_snp: The number of SNPs in the PRS being evaluated

  • freq: The frequency of appearance for these SNPs

  • full_r2: The R^2 of the full regression model, i.e. the regression model including the covariates and the PRS

  • full_pvalue: The p-value of the full regression model

  • prs_pvalue: The p-value of the PRS coefficient in the model

  • full_aic: The AIC of the full regression model

  • reduced_r2: The R^2 of the reduced model, i.e. the regression model including only the covariates and excluding the PRS

  • prs_r2: The R^2 attributed to the PRS (full_r2 - reduced_r2)

  • reduced_pvalue: The p-value of the reduced regression model

  • reduced_aic: The AIC of the reduced regression model

  • prs_aic: The AIC of the PRS (full_aic - reduced_aic)

Author

Panagiotis Moulos

Examples

    data(toy,package="prisma")
    data(prisma_out,package="prisma")
    
    response <- "BMI"
    covariates <- c("Case_Control","Gender","Age")
    
    can <- getPrsCandidates(prismaOut,"glm",1)
    m <- prsRegressionMetrics(can,toy,response=response,
        covariates=covariates,pcs=FALSE)
#> 
#> Regressing with GLM
#> Trait(s)    : BMI
#> Covariate(s): Case_Control, Gender, Age
#> Regression  : gaussian (predicted)
#> Use PCs     : No
#> Creating the reduced model
#> Creating the null model
#> Testing full models
#>   testing PRS with SNPs from rs11876399 to rs2825190
#>   testing PRS with SNPs from rs11876399 to rs8093690
#>   testing PRS with SNPs from rs11876399 to rs9977496
